intro: Hieracium vulgatum var. abietinum, commonly known as the Alpine hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, preferring well-drained soils. It is known for its ability to thrive in cold climates and high altitudes. Its botanical features make it an important component of alpine ecosystems.
